page.title: 02WEATHER PATTERNS
page.content: {DUNSMORE AREA On the north_facing scarp slope of the Chiltern Hills, Coombe Hill being the highest point in the range, the weather is cold rather than warm and is subject to extremes. Snow lies long on the north slope in winter,while in hot summers the chalky soil quickly becomes hard_baked, and cracked. The hills themselves often break up a weather pattern; heavy rain may be falling on the other side of the hills in High Wycombe or Marlow while the north slope remains dry and rain free and the rainfall continues in the Vale of Aylesbury 2mls away. It may also happen the other way round. The steep sided deep valleys, usually running north/south and characteristic of the area, are more sheltered from the elements. They are on the whole water free and are termed BOTTOMS locally
